page.title: 17CUSTOMS
page.content: {MACMERRY}is a small village situated to the extreme west of the grid.The original row of cottages still stands. The expansion sites are council owned. Housing stock - 239 3apt,93 4apt,and 32 5apt.The local school is the focal pont of village life.There is a nursery school. At local weddings the old custom of 'CREELING'is still observed.When the couple return from the church the newly wed husband has a creel with stones placed on his back.He carries this until his new wife kisses him in front of the villagers.Only then is the creel allowed to fall.The creel represents the willingness of the groom to accept marital responsibilities and the kiss the wife's willingness to stand by her husband.
